Package src.ListADT

Interface ListInterface<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
ResizeableList
public interface ListInterface<T>
The ListInterface interface which we later implement to create a ResizeableList. This interface contains definitions for various methods that are integral for the existence of any list (resizeable or not). These methods allow for functionalities such as adding, removing, swapping, setting/getting elements, counting elements, clearing, and many checkers (such as contains, isEmpty, isFull). Each of these methods is documented separately.
Version:
1.1
Author:
George Matta, Pierlorenzo Peruzzo

  • Method Details

    • add

      void add(int index, T entry)
      Adds the entry to the specified index (such that arr[index] == entry).
      Parameters:
      index - The index we want to add the entry to
      entry - The entry we want to add to the list

    • add

      void add(T entry)
      Adds an entry to a specified index. This would delegate to the add(int, T) method, adding the entry at a specified and unchanging index. In most cases, this index would be the end of the list, but it can also be the front of the list (or any index for that matter)
      Parameters:
      entry - The entry we want to add to the list

    • remove

      T remove(int index)
      Removes an element from the list given an index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index we want to remove from the list.
      Returns:
      A generic-type object of the item removed from the list

    • remove

      T remove()
      Removes an element from the list from a specified index. This delegates to the remove(int, T) method, removing an entry from a specified index. In most cases, this index would be the end of the list, but it can also be the front of the list (or any index for that matter)
      Returns:
      A generic-type object of the item removed from the list

    • set

      T set(int index, T entry)
      Sets an element at an index to be the entry. Unlike add, this method does not increase the total number of entries of the list. It only replaces an element.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the element we want to replace.
      entry - The entry we want to replace the element with.
      Returns:
      A generic-type object of the item removed from the list

    • get

      T get(int index)
      Gets an element from the list given an index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the element we want to get.
      Returns:
      The element at the index.

    • swap

      void swap(int firstIndex, int secondIndex)
      Swaps two elements at two indices.
      Parameters:
      firstIndex - The index of the first element to be swapped.
      secondIndex - The index of the second element to be swapped.

    • getFreqOf

      int getFreqOf(T entry)
      Counts the occurences of a specified entry.
      Parameters:
      entry - The entry we want to count the occurences of
      Returns:
      The frequency of the entry

    • contains

      boolean contains(T entry)
      Checks if an element is in the list.
      Parameters:
      entry - The entry we want to check the existence of.
      Returns:
      true if the element is in the list, false if it isn't.

    • getIndexOf

      int getIndexOf(T entry)
      Finds the first occurence of an element in the list and returns its index.
      Parameters:
      entry - The entry we are looking for in the list
      Returns:
      The index of the specified entry. -1 if it is not in the list.

    • getCapacity

      int getCapacity()
      Gets the capacity of the list. This is how many elements can be added to the list (without any resizing).
      Returns:
      The capacity of the list.

    • getNumEntries

      int getNumEntries()
      Gets the number of entries of a list. This is how many elements have been added to the list.
      Returns:
      The number of entries in the list.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if there are no entries in the list.
      Returns:
      true if the list is empty, false if it isn't.

    • isFull

      boolean isFull()
      Checks if we have added 'capacity' number of elements
      Returns:
      true if the number of entries is the same as the capacity, false if isn't.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears a list of all its elements.

    • getArray

      T[] getArray()
      Returns the pure Java Array of the ListInterface object
      Returns:
      An array of generic-type objects

    • count

      int count()
      Gets the number of the entries in the List
      Returns:
      The number of entries.
